result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Deckow Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John A Deckow Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John A Deckow Jr was found guilty of Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Sentence may be served in another county, if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A Deckow Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.

9:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed.  Defendant concurs.  State concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2 days county jail to commence within 60 days and with huber
Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Sentence may be served in another county if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County.

Court adjourned at 10:00 a.m.

9:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites offer.  Defendant will not accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court determines the defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant called and requested an adjournment as his car broke down.  Matter adjourned to September 8, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Address on file is correct.
43
